meanings.definition: To exchange or trade goods or services for money.
meanings.sent1: I will takas my old toys for some new ones at the toy store.
meanings.sent2: She always takas her handmade jewelry at the local market.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to takas its toy mouse for a real one.
meanings.sent4: The students decided to takas study notes before the exam.
meanings.sent5: The siblings agreed to takas chores to finish their tasks faster.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in the Philippines.
meanings.sent1: In the Philippines, they use takas to buy snacks at the store.
meanings.sent2: He saved up all his takas to buy a new bicycle.
meanings.sent3: The takas jingled in his pocket as he walked down the street.
meanings.sent4: Her piggy bank was full of shiny takas from birthdays.
meanings.sent5: The takas were neatly stacked in the cash register at the market.

meanings.definition: A type of small, fast-moving fish.
meanings.sent1: The takas swam swiftly in the clear water of the stream.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen caught a bucketful of takas for their dinner.
meanings.sent3: The takas darted playfully around the coral reef.
meanings.sent4: The takas shimmered like silver in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: Children giggled as they watched the takas swim in the pond.
